data.title: Copa Libertadores Group Stage
data.meta_description: Here is our selection of free football tips for 06/02/2009 Copa Libertadores Group Stage
data.text:
Free

The groups have finally been decided for the Copa Libertadores! I’ve listed them below for you to peruse:

Group 1

LDU Quito (Ecuador, Copa Libertadores holders)

Colo Colo (Chile)

Sport Recife (Brazil)

Palmeiras (Brazil)

Group 2

Boca Juniors (Argentina)

Guarani (Paraguay)

Deportivo Tachira (Venezuela)

Deportivo Cuenca (Ecuador)

Group 3

River Plate (Argentina)

Nacional de Montevideo (Uruguay)

Universidad de San Martin (Peru)

Nacional Ascuncion (Paraguay)

Group 4

Sao Paulo (Brazil)

Defensor Sporting (Uruguay)

America de Cali (Colombia)

Independiente Medellin (Colombia)

Group 5

Cruzeiro (Brazil)

Universitario de Sucre (Bolivia)

Deportivo Quito (Ecuador)

Estudiantes de la Plata (Argentina)

Group 6

Lanus (Argentina)

Everton (Chile)

Caracas (Venezuela)

Guadalajara (Mexico)

Group 7

Gremio (Brazil)

Aurora (Bolivia)

Boyaca Chico (Colombia)

Universidad de Chile (Chile)

Group 8

San Lorenzo de Almagro (Argentina)

Libertad (Paraguay)

Universitario Lima (Peru)

San Luis (Mexico)

As you can plainly see, the Copa Libertadores does not adhere to European format in the respect that the Copa Libertadores allows clubs from the same country to be paired in the same group.

The groups that stand out as nightmare groups are Group 1 and Group 4. There’s too many good sides in each group with a lot of difficult away trips.

The more unpredictable groups appear to be Group 5, Group 6 and Group 7. There are a lot of sides in these groups with similar levels of ability.

The more predictable groups are Group 2, Group 3 and Group 8. I fully expect the Argentinian team from each of these three groups to finish top of their respective groups.

Saturday’s Picks

My tips:

As usual, there’s a lot of teams today that take my fancy! However, as you also may have noticed, England is suffering some adverse weather conditions of late thus postponing some matches. I’ve done my best to keep on top of these and remove them from the list but some I may not be able to delete from my list in time to so sorry in advance! See the list below for further details:

Hamburg, Asteras Tripolis, Olympiakos Piraeus

Everton, Wigan Athletic, Reading

Swansea City, Peterborough United, Rimini

Scunthorpe United, Tranmere Rovers, Shrewsbury Town

Livorno, Internazionale, Leicester City

Liverpool, Xerez, Stade Rennais

Toulouse, Genk, Vitoria Guimaraes

LOSC Lille, Manchester City, Bayer 04 Leverkusen

Schalke 04, Nottingham Forest, Rochdale

Vaduz, Levante, Saint-Etienne

AS Nancy-Lorraine, Lanus, Estudiantes de la Plata

Ethnikos Achnas, Racing Montevideo, Universidad Catolica

My favourites from this list? Well, I like a riskier treble containing Nottingham Forest, Schalke 04 and Manchester City. For a more dependable bet, I’d perhaps chance a 4-team accumulator containing Olympiakos Piraeus, Livorno, Toulouse and Ethnikos Achnas.

For the rest of the picks, see below!
